contour.py¶

NOTE: TODO: - function that normalizes a sequence of midi tones to the same starting value.

decitala.contour.pitch_space_contour_from_midi(midi_array, as_str=False)¶

Given an array of midi values, returns the pitch space contour. See The Perception of Rhythm in Non-Tonal Music: Rhythmic Contours in the Music of Edgard Varèse (Marvin, 1991)

>>> frag = np.array([60, 65, 68, 72])
>>> pitch_space_contour_from_midi(midi_array=frag)
array([0, 1, 2, 3])
>>> pitch_space_contour_from_midi(midi_array=frag, as_str=True)
'<0 1 2 3>'
decitala.contour.normalize_pitch_content(data, midi_start)¶

Given an array of midi content, returns the same material transposed according to the midi_start value (i.e. intervals are maintained)

>>> frag = np.array([61, 65, 68, 60, 51])
>>> normalize_pitch_content(frag, 42)
array([42, 46, 49, 41, 32])
decitala.contour.uds_contour(data)¶

Stands for “up-down-stay” as a measure of pitch contour. Normalized to start at 0.

>>> frag = np.array([47, 42, 45, 51, 51, 61, 58])
>>> uds_contour(frag)
array([ 0, -1,  1,  1,  0,  1, -1])
decitala.contour.single_tuples_to_array(data)¶
>>> frag = ((62,), (25,), (52,), (31,))
>>> single_tuples_to_array(frag)
array([62, 25, 52, 31])
decitala.contour.format_pitch_data(data)¶

The data format for pitch content in Paths is somewhat messy. This makes it easier to use.
